title.narrative: INCLUSIVE BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Increased national and sub-national capacity to legislate, plan and budget for and monitor equitable access to inclusive quality basic education., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Equitable access to Child-Friendly Schools that are inclusive, academically effective, gender-sensitive, healthy, safe protective, and involve families and communities

System strengthening - mother tongue / multilingual education
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased national and sub-national capacity to legislate, plan and budget for and monitor equitable access to inclusive qualitybasic education.

description.narrative: UNICEF Mongolia&39;s inclusive basic education interventions benefited an increased number of disadvantaged children with disabilities, ethnic minority children, monastic boys and other out-of-school children in remote rural soums and Buddhist temples and generated good practices that can be replicated to other areas and inform national and local education policies. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2017

title.narrative: b1c. Innovations to improve access and learning for the most disadvantaged children are implemented at scale and are sustainable - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2016:25 mobile ger schools to reach OOSC, 8 learning and recreational centers for CwD in regular schools/NFEs, and 6 e-learning classrooms established and operational in 2 GFAs.

title.narrative: Schools that were supported by UNICEF to become accessible to children with disabilities

actual.value: 2016:Five regular schools/NFE centers in Khuvsgul and 2 schools and 1 NFE Center in Nalaikh.

title.narrative: Innovative Pilot to improve access to education and learning outcomes for the most disadvantaged and excluded children

actual.value: 2016:3 (mobile ger schools, learning and recreational centers for CwD at regular schools, e-learning centers.)

title.narrative: e6c. Availability of sufficient resources to allow children to learn in their mother tongue during the early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
d2. Cluster coordination mechanism for education sector rating for the 7 core cluster functions (incl. accountability to affected populations)

baseline.value: Cluster members not trained in EiE basics

actual.value: 2016:Cluster contingency plan inclusive of scenarios of “dzud” winter emergency and earthquake disaster was updated.

title.narrative: d2. Cluster coordination mechanism for education sector rating for the 7 core cluster functions (incl. accountability to affected populations)

baseline.value: Cluster members not trained in EiE basics

actual.value: 2016:Improved cluster coordination resulted in the National Strategy Forum on Safe Schools and Kindergartens.

title.narrative: A functional learning assessment system (especially for early grades) established

actual.value: 2016:Yes. National learning achievement studies for samples of grades 5, 9 and 11 conducted in 2014, 2015 and 2016.

title.narrative: e6a. Existence of a national law or policy that fosters multilingual education to allow children to learn in their mother tongue during the early grades - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Number of learning materials developed for ethnic minority students -0

actual.value: 2016:“Tuvan language 2” student's textbook and teacher's guidebook newly developed. Four first grade primary education textbooks translated into Tuvan.
